description: In this course students examine Christians' enduring concern over such matters as what happiness
is; the role, if any, virtues play in the lives of Christians and their lives with God.  Topics
include the early church's response to Greek philosophy, interpretations of sin, Christ's
humanity, and human flourishing.  Students also examine how these theological conversations
continue to shape modern reflection on what makes a person happy and a life well-lived.  Offered
fullname: Blessed are the Happy? Virtue, Happiness, & Good Life in Christian Tht
